sub_topic: Finding the velocity and acceleration of an object using calculus
message_1: A car is traveling along a straight road at a constant acceleration of 5 m/s². Its initial velocity is 20 m/s. Use calculus to find the velocity and acceleration of the car after 7 seconds.
message_2:
To find the velocity of the car after 7 seconds, we can use the formula:

v(t) = v0 + at

where v(t) is the velocity at time t, v0 is the initial velocity, a is the acceleration, and t is the time.

In this case, v0 = 20 m/s, a = 5 m/s², and t = 7 seconds.

v(7) = 20 + 5(7)
v(7) = 20 + 35
v(7) = 55 m/s

So, the velocity of the car after 7 seconds is 55 m/s.

Since the acceleration is constant, it remains the same at 5 m/s² after 7 seconds.
